intro: Marila laxiflora var. multinervia, commonly known as the slender-flowered marila, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped with a prominent central vein, giving it the "multinervia" designation. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories.
